= process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
literally: great one; hence: = someone in a position of authority at a royal court or on a ship
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state in which humans or deities are exceedingly powerful
= state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect
= state in which humans have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= something that can be heard; ◄ produced by humans, directly or with the help of a musical instrument ► in order to communicate a message

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which a certain event starts happening

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; ≈ associated with mortality
= causative action by which humans or deities force (other) humans or animals to leave their place or position
= animal; ◄ generic, sometimes referring to all animals, sometimes limited to wild land animals only
= uncultivated, uninhabited land, ► where wild animals can live free
= the place where a person or deity resides
= large ruminant animal with horns and cloven hoofs, ► domesticated primarily for meat or milk, as a beast of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; a clean animal which can be eaten and sacrificed
= causative action by which humans give animals food to eat
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time, from a moment to a year or longer
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state of being in an elevated position or at a level of importance or status; attribute of God
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; ≈ associated with mortality

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state/process by which humans or deities experience a strong desire to perform an event
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; ≈ associated with mortality
= causative action by which humans or deities force (other) humans or animals to leave their place or position
= large ruminant animal with horns and cloven hoofs, ► domesticated primarily for meat or milk, as a beast of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; a clean animal which can be eaten and sacrificed
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life enhancing; associated with fertility

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= the physical body of humans and animals, not including the mind and the inner person
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle
= a horny covering on each digit of the foot of humans and certain animals
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state of being in an elevated position or at a level of importance or status; attribute of God

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= the duration of time that is unending
= the duration of time that is unending
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= state in which someone resides in a certain place

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to think of|to have regard for
Node.definition: = state/process by which humans or deities consider something or someone valuable or of interest
= state/process by which humans or deities experience a strong desire to perform an event

= an organized military force equipped for fighting on land; this term denotes primarily the foot soldiers, though it can also be used to refer to the entire fighting force, including chariots and horsemen

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= state in which someone resides in a certain place

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which an object or event is either present or existing

Node.gloss: to slap (someone) on (their) hands|to hold (someone) back
Node.definition: literally: to strike on (someone's) hand; hence: = causative action by which someone prevents someone else from performing a certain event and which contains an implied rebuke
literally: to strike (someone's) hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to stop engaging in a certain activity

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect
= state in which humans have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= state in which humans have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= person providing counsel to someone in authority
= action by which humans make a polite request to someone in authority or a deity
= state in which humans are firmly in a position of power
= state in which an event is being done to a larger extent than is normally done
literally: to add; hence: = process by which a certain quality of humans increases in intensity, either in actual fact or in the eyes of others
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do
= action by which humans acknowledge the elevated status of deities and give expression to that
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= state in which words or actions are true and reliable
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= the act of giving a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensure that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in vindication for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans
